attachments.title: How to use RecyclerView inside NestedScrollView?
attachments.text: How to use RecyclerView inside NestedScrollView?RecyclerView content is not visible after setting adapter.UPDATE layout code updated.<android.support.v4.widget.NestedScrollView xmlns:android="
attachments.fallback: How to use RecyclerView inside NestedScrollView?

text:
<@U2M0WUZ7A>: Thank you for the reply. I removed the NestedScrollView and set:
```<android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView
                    android:id="@+id/list"
                    app:layout_behavior="@string/appbar_scrolling_view_behavior"
                    android:layout_width="match_parent"
                    android:layout_height="wrap_content"
                    android:background="@color/profileBg"
                    xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android" />```
As described in the link but the effect is not the same. Yes in this way the problem with the back is not there but only the recycle view scrolls. I have used the NestedScrollView so the whole content can scroll because I have two Layouts above the recycle view which should scroll with the recycle view.
If I have a NestedScrollView the whole content moves when I scroll the recycle view, without it - the recycle view scrolls in place
<@U0Z248CVB> your layouts should also refer to some `layout_behavior` to be scrollable (to act like collapsible toolbars).

        xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"

        android:layout_width="match_parent"
        android:layout_height="match_parent"

text: I set layout_behavior to them also but it’s the same...
Try removing behavior from the root layout.
same. only the recycle view scrolls
In the link you gave me there is no a CoordinatorLayout
AFAIK, layout behavior works only inside of Coordinator.
Any expert on Google Location Services here? :smile:

<@U2M0WUZ7A>: I am sorry, I haven’t used CordinatorLayout before. I updated my code above and the effect is what I want but when I scrolled to the last item follows a white space and doesn’t matter how much I scroll I can’t go back to top
Can’t say anything now. Coordinator is a bit tricky. Try posting your layout code.
it;s above. I updated my code
What to choose for  publish/subscribe messaging between app and server? Requirements: Low network overhead and low power usage?
<@U0Z248CVB> try moving your Recycler out of Collapsible Toolbar.
I tried. In this way the whole content is not scrolling just recycle view in place

> follows a white space
it is a place for content, when your toolbar is fully collapsed
<@U2M0WUZ7A> my mistake. I have put it outside AppBarLayout not outside Collapsible Toolbar. Now it scrolls but only few items, not to the bottom of the recycle view.
Layout structure should be like this: <http://stackoverflow.com/questions/30546812/coordinatorlayout-with-recyclerview-collapsingtoolbarlayout>

Hm question. I have two library projects A and B. A depends on B via gradle so A can easily access data B provides. Now my issue is that suddenly B needs a specific piece of data that A provides. What would be a solution to this? Moving the respective code to B is not an option in my case.
I was afraid of that answer lol
what we did in the past was have a `coreUtils` or something like that, that was basically just interfaces
We have something like that for a different use case. Common project defines interface and other project implements it. Would just be a little overkill here
whatever you want to call it
I think facade is more heavyweight than this
One day I'll get a nice unidirectional data flow into this app. Until then I gotta deal with the multi*dimensional* one ;)
a little reflection never killed anyone

We just published ConstraintLayout beta 4. As always, it's available in the SDK Manager (under the "Support Repository" section).Note: if you are using Android Studio 2.2, you might have to do File->Invalidate Caches & restart studio after installing this version (the editor behavior may not be correct, with widgets temporarily snapping to the top left corner or not shown).This release fixes a few bugs related to...
